recipes.name: Broccoli Gravy Curry
ingredients: 2 cups broccoli florets (cleaned and washed in salted water)
1 tbsp channa dal / senaga pappu (for roasting)
1 tbsp urad dal/ senaga pappu (for roasting)
instructions: Heat a pan and dry roast the dals. Towards the end add cumin to warm it up. Set this aside to cool and grind to fine powder.
To the same pan, add oil and heat up, add cumin and bay leaf and sauté to get an aroma.
Add onions and fry till golden. Add potatoes and fry for 2 mins.
Cover and cook on a low flame till the potatoes are almost cooked. During this, the onions get caramelized and potatoes get browned and they begin to release a nice aroma.
Add broccoli, sprinkle salt and turmeric. Fry for 2 to 3 mins on medium high.
Cover and cook till the broccoli is half cooked.
Add red chili powder, garam masala, mix well and fry for a min or 2.
Pour the ground mix and some water. Cover and cook till the gravy thickens. It takes only 2 to 3 mins. Do not overcook broccoli.
Serve broccoli gravy curry with chapathi, roti or paratha.

recipes.name: Pea and Potato Bhaji
instructions: Heat the oil in a large nonstick frying pan and when it is hot add the mustard seeds.
Stir-fry for 3 minutes until they start to 'pop', then add ginger, cumin, red chilli, peas & potatoes.
Stir fry over a high heat for 3-4 minutes, add the water, cover and reduce the heat to low.
Cook gently for 2-3 minutes and remove from heat.
Season and sprinkle over the coconut and serve with rotis.

recipes.name: Creamy Spinach
ingredients: 600 grams spinach, washed and finely chopped
instructions: Heat butter in a heavy-based pan.
Add the whole dry red chillies and fry till they darken.
Add the ginger and fry till it is light brown.
Add the chopped spinach, sugar, salt and mix well on high heat.
Cook without covering on medium-high heat stirring frequently for about 20 minutes or till the spinach is cooked and dry.
Mix in the cream.

recipes.name: Mirchi ka Salan
instructions: Roast coriander, cumin, poppy and sesame seeds on a griddle and pound.
Roast coconut too. Wash and soak tamarind in 240 ml/1 cup water.
Mash well, then squeeze out and discard pulp.
Remove stem, slit and deseed chillies without separating them.
Pat dry. Heat oil in a kadhai. Fry potatoes till golden brown.
Remove. Reserve a few green chillies for garnish.
Fry the rest till soft. Drain.
In the same oil brown the ginger and garlic pastes, ground seeds, turmeric, chilli powder, curry leaves and coconut.
Add green chillies and 480 ml/2 cups water.
Cover and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add fried potatoes and simmer till chillies and potatoes are tender.
Add tamarind juice through a stainer and let simmer till gravy thickens.
Garnish with slit green chillies and serve with plain boiled rice.

recipes.name: Makki Ki Sabzi
instructions: Heat the oil, add the cumin seeds and onions and sauté till the onions are golden brown.
Add the ginger and garlic pastes.
Cook until brown.
Mix the turmeric powder in 1⁄2 cup of water.
Add to the pan and cook for 5 minutes on a low flame.
When the mixture leaves the sides of the pan, add the corn and fry for 5 minutes.
Add 2 cups of water, cover and cook on a low flame for 10-12 minutes.
When the corn is tender and the liquid has almost dried, mix in the cream.
Garnish with green coriander and serve.

recipes.name: Broccoflower Masala
instructions: Cut the vegetable into small florets and wash them nicely.
Heat little oil and fry the chopped onions, garlic and ginger. Grind this into a smooth paste with cashew nuts.
Again heat 4tbsp of oil and add the ground masala and fry until the water evaporates from it.
Add the chopped tomato, chilly powder, turmeric, pepper powder and cook until the tomatoes are done.
Add the florets, water and salt and cook until the gravy becomes thick.
Finally garnish with cilantro and serve with chapthi, parota or naan.

recipes.name: Cabbage
instructions: Soak the chopped cabbage in water with some salt for 10-15 minutes and drain.
Heat oil in a pan.
When it crackles, add the green chili and ginger and saute for 1 minute.
Add the cabbage, salt to taste.
Saute it mixing all the ingredients well.
Cook over a low heat uncovered until it reaches your preferred consistency.
Garnish with coconut.
Cabbage is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Stuffed Tomatoes
ingredients: 1 seeded and very finely chopped green cheese
4 seeded and very finely chopped green chillies
instructions: Wash and dry the tomatoes, take off its top, scoop out seeds, mix all the ingredients except black pepper powder.
Fill the tomatoes with the mixture, quite full.
Sprinkle black pepper powder.
Greased an oven tray with 1 tsp margarine.
Place tomatoes on it in a distance.
Bake it in a preheat oven for 10 minutes until cheese melts and come out of the tomatoes.
Serve the dish as it is.
Do not shift the tomatoes in any other plate.

recipes.name: Kesari Paneer
ingredients: Big pinch of saffron (soaked in little water)
instructions: Make a tomato sauce by boiling the tomatoes, flavoured with ginger & garlic, cardamom & mace and the red chilli powder.
Add water as required.
When sauce is ready strain it through a wire seive.
Heat oil in a pan and add strained sauce.
Add salt, pepper and gram masala powder.
Stir in a piece of cottage cheese and simmer for 5-8 minutes.
Stir in butter, cream, saffron and garnish with coriander leaves.

recipes.name: Curried Red Kidney Beans and Cauliflower
ingredients: 1 can whole peeled plum tomatoes, without juice
1 serrano chile, stemmed, seeded, and minced
4 cans cooked red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1/2 head cauliflower, cut into 1/2- to 1-in. florets
1 to 1 1/2 tbsp freshly squeezed lemon juice
1/2 cup loosely packed coarsely chopped cilantro sprigs
instructions: Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed 4- to 5-qt. pot or saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add onion and fry, stirring occasionally, 2 to 3 minutes, or until slightly softened.
Stir in cinnamon, bay leaf, garlic, ginger, fennel, cumin, and cardamom and fry, stirring, 2 minutes.
Add cayenne, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala and fry, stirring, 1 minute.
Shred tomatoes into pot with your fingers. Stir in serrano chile, salt, kidney beans, cauliflower, and 1 1/2 cups water.
Lower heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 20 minutes, or until cauliflower is tender and liquid has thickened into a velvety-looking sauce (add more water if necessary).
Season beans with salt. Stir in lemon juice and cilantro.
Serve hot over rice, with plain yogurt on the side if you like.

recipes.name: Chutney Potatoes
instructions: Blend together fresh mint, lemon juice, green chillies and green coriander into a puree.
Heat oil in a heavy bottomed pan.
Add ginger-garlic paste and potatoes.
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder and red chilli paste.
Stir-fry add salt and 250ml water.
Bring to boil and simmer till the potatoes are cooked.
Add blend puree and stir-fry for 4-5 minutes.
Add salt, if necessary, and serve hot.

recipes.name: Chawli Beans
instructions: Heat oil in a pressure cooker and season with mustard seeds and asafoetida.
Immediately add chopped onions and fry till brown.
Add finely chopped brinjals and after five minutes, add the chawle beans which have been soaked in water overnight and cleaned.
Add turmeric powder, chilli powder, garam masala, salt and a minimum amount of water.
Pressure cook for about 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove lid and cook till all the water evaporates.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

recipes.name: Besan Ki Hari Mirch
instructions: Roast the gram flour in a wok for 5 minutes till it emanates a roasted fragrance.
Add all the dry spices along with water and cook till a thick paste-like consistency is obtained.
Stir continuously. Remove from the flame and put aside to cool.
Stuff the green chillies with the gram flour paste.
Heat the oil and fry the green chillies.
Uncovered on a low flame till they become tender and change colour.
Remove from the flame and serve hot.

recipes.name: Masala Karela
ingredients: 90 gms boiled and diced potatoes (for stuffing)
instructions: Apply salt liberally on the bitter gourds after scraping off the skin.
Slit lengthwise on one side.
Apply a little turmeric powder, leave for 6 hours.
Then squeeze out all the bitter juice.
Heat 1 tbsp. oil and add the onions (for the stuffing) till golden in colour.
Add all the other ingredients.
Fill the bitter gourds with this stuffing and tie each with string.
Fry the ground masala in 2 tbsps. oil to make the gravy.
Add 2 finely chopped tomatoes to it.
Then add the tamarind pulp and sugar and cook till well blended.
Arrange the bittergourds in the gravy. Cook till they are tender.

recipes.name: Khatta Chana
instructions: Soak the chickpeas overnight. Drain.
Put the chickpeas in a pressure cooker, cover with water, throw in a tea bag and cook for about 20 minutes.
Remove the tea bag.
On a griddle, dry roast separately, the coriander and cumin seeds and the red chillies, then grind them together.
Mix in the pomegranate powder or mango powder and keep this powdered masala mix aside.
Heat the oil in a pan, fry the juliennes of ginger till they turn light brown, and add the chickpeas.
Sprinkle the powdered masala mix, and the salt, add the fried potatoes, and cook for about 5 minutes.
When almost ready, add the garam masala powder.
Serve garnished with onion rings, green chillies & coriander leaves.

recipes.name: Tofu & Spring Onion
instructions: Cut the tofu into cubes and put it on a heatproof plate.
Scatter the spring onion, chilli, corriander and soy sauce over the tofu.
Put the oils into a small saucepan and heat until they are smoking.
Then immediately pour the oils over the tofu.

recipes.name: Bagharay Baigan
instructions: On a griddle, roast peanuts with poppy seeds, sesame seeds, coriander and cumin on medium heat for 3-4 minutes.
Pierce the onion onto a fork or knife and roast it over a direct for 5-7 minutes until the peel turns black.
Peel the onion and grind it with the roasted spices, salt, red chilli powder, coconut and turmeric to make a paste.
Wash and brinjals and make a crosscut at the back for stuffing.
Put a pinch of salt in the crosscut and stuff the ground paste into each brinjal. Tightly close by pressing with both hands and keep aside.
Method for Gravy:
In a pot, heat Oil on medium heat for 2-3 minutes and add all the whole spices.
When they pop, add ground onion and fry till slightly golden.
Add the remaining spices and stir well, sprinkling a little water form time to time.
When oil begins to separate from the spices, add the brinjal and 1/2 cup water.
Cover and cook on medium heat for 5-7 minutes. Then add tamarind and simmer on low heat for 5-7 minutes. Dish out and garnish.
Serve with boiled rice.

recipes.name: Gatte ki Sabzi
instructions: Sieve the gram flour & mix the red chilli powder, finely chopped mint, garam masala powder, salt, and three tbsp hot oil to form a hard dough.
Roll and make into thick long strips.
Boil these strips in water for about 10-12 minutes till they become hard & white.
Cut into slices. These are called gattas.
Heat 4 tbsp oil in a pan & fry cumin seeds, green chillies, asafoetida, and coriander & turmeric powders, on low heat.
Add yoghurt, salt, and water for the gravy. Stir well.
Add the gattas, the raisins, and mango powder.
Cook for about 10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves & serve with roti.

recipes.name: Spinach, Red Pepper and Chickpea
instructions: Heat the oil in a large nonstick frying pan.
Add the ginger and garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds over a medium heat.
Add the shallot and red pepper and stir and cook for 5-6 minutes until slightly softened.
Stir in the chilli powder, ground cumin, ground coriander and tomato puree.
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, then pour in the measured water, stir and bring to the boil.
Stir in the spinach and chickpeas and cook for 5-6 minutes until the spinach has just wilted.
Season and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Bharta
ingredients: 1 tsp roasted and powdered cumin seeds
1 bunch finely chopped fresh coriander (save some for garnish)
instructions: Peel and mash boiled potatoes.
Add all ingredients except oil and onions. Mix and set aside for 15 minutes.
Heat oil and fry onions till golden brown. Remove half to absorbent paper; in the remaining half add mashed potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Stirring frequently.
Serve sprinkled with fried onions and chopped fresh coriander with hot puri or naan.

recipes.name: Piaz Bhaji
instructions: Heat the ghee in a saucepan and fry the sliced ginger, chopped garlic and chopped chilies for a few minutes.
Add sliced onions and chopped tomatoes to the ghee.
Then add turmeric, garam masala and salt and cook on a low heat until onions are golden brown.
Add a little water if necessary.

recipes.name: Stuffed Capsicum
ingredients: 2 each yellow, orange and red capsicum
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Heat the oil for filling one and fry the aubergine, stirring frequently, till softened.
Add the tomatoes and break up with a wooden spoon.
Put the couscous in a heatproof bowl.
Cover with boiling water until the liquid is absorbed.
Fluff up with a fork, stir in the aubergine mixture and season.
For filling two, heat the oil and cook the celery till softened.
Reconstitute the noodles according to the packet instructions, then drain.
Stir in the celery and pesto.
For filling three, melt the butter and cook the fennel till softened.
Stir in the spinach, remove from the heat, then add the chickpeas.
Cut the tops from the capsicum and reserve, scoop out the seeds.
Sprinkle a little salt and pepper in each.
Spoon the fillings into the capsicum and replace the tops.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, till they have softened and the fillings are piping hot.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Okra and Cucumber
instructions: Slice the okra diagonally into 1 cm (1/2 inch) slices.
Heat the oil in a large, nonstick frying pan and when hot add the mustard seeds.
As they begin to 'pop', add the dried red chillies and onion.
Stir-fry and cook over a medium heat for 4-5 minutes until the onion has softened and then stir in the tomatoes, cucumber, garlic, ginger and turmeric.
Stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes and then turn the heat to high and add the sliced okra.
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, season and remove from the heat.
Sprinkle over the grated coconut and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Patra
instructions: Mix gram flour, wheat atta, tamarind pulp, asafoetida, jaggery salt, chilli powder and soda bi-carb.
Make it into a thick paste.
Wash arvi leaves and remove stems and veins.
Smear the batter behind the leaves.
Put 3-4 leaves one on top of the other and roll tightly.
Steam the rolls tied with string for an hour.
Cool and cut into slices.
Season with mustard seeds and til.

recipes.name: Stuffed Tindas
instructions: Wash the tindas and peel them.
Cut a slice of the top and scoop out the seeds.
Mix together chilli, coriander powder, turmeric powder, few chopped green coriander leaves; lime juice, grated coconut, mava, garam masala and salt. Stuff the tindas with the prepared mixture.
Put the top slices back.
Cook covered on moderate heat till the tindas are soft.

recipes.name: Green Tomato Rassa
instructions: Grind onions and peppercorns finely and add to the coconut milk.
Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds and quartered tomatoes.
Pour in the coconut milk with ground onion and peppercorns.
Add salt to taste.
Add chilli powder and turmeric powder.
Boil only once.
Garnish with coriander and serve with rice.

recipes.name: Aloo Gobhi Dum
instructions: Heat 2 tbsps. ghee and fry the cauliflower pieces till brown in colour.
Peel the potatoes and deep-fry them.
Then heat 1 tbsps. ghee and fry the ground masala, stirring all the time till rich brown in colour.
Add the fried vegetables and salt.
Cover with a lid. Cook on a low flame, without adding any water, till tender.

recipes.name: Mushroom Soya
instructions: Wash mushrooms in flowing water, drain well and cut into quarters.
Boil soya bean wadi in warm water for 5 to 7 minutes.
Squeeze to remove excess water, cut them into two and keep aside.
Peel, wash and chop ginger, garlic and onion.
Wash tomatoes and finely chop.
Clean mint, wash and finely chop.
Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add bay leaf, crushed pepper corn and stir-fry briefly.
Add chopped ginger, garlic and cook on high flame for half a minute, stirring continuously.
Add chopped onion and continue cooking until onion turns translucent.
Add red chilli powder, coriander powder and turmeric powder and stir well.
Mix in the chopped tomatoes and continue cooking over medium heat.
Add the mushrooms and soaked soya bean wadi. Stir well.
Sprinkle garam masala powder, chopped mint and add salt.
Mix well. Cook over high heat for two minutes.
Cover and simmer over medium heat for two to three minutes.

recipes.name: Beans Yogurt Sauce
instructions: Stiring French beans, wash them and then cut into three inch long pieces.
Blanch in salted boiling water until cooked.
Strain, refresh in cold water and then drain.
Wash, trim & finely chop spring onion.
Peel & wash ginger & garlic.
Grind ginger and garlic to a fine paste.
Crush dry whole red chillies.
Beat skimmed milk yogurt with maize flour.
Wash tomatoes, make a cross with knife and then blanch in boiling water for fifteen seconds.
Remove peel, de-seed and then chop.
Heat the oil in a non-stick pan, add spring onion and cook till translucent.
Add ginger and garlic pastes.
Stir for a moment. Add tomatoes and cook further for two to three minutes.
Reduce heat & add skimmed milk yogurt & maize flour, mix well, add salt to taste & stir continuously.
Mix the cooked bean with the prepared yogurt sauce.
Sprinkle the crushed chilies and serve hot.

recipes.name: Kathal Curry
instructions: Peel off the thorny skin of the jackfruit.
Wash and cut into slice of 1/4 thickness.
Add a little salt to curd and apply the curd to the jackfruit slices. Keep aside.
Now on a griddle roast mustard and cumin seeds.
Grind garlic, ginger, coconut, red chillies, turmeric powder, coriander, roasted mustard, cumin seeds, poppy seeds and salt to a fine paste.
Divide the masala into two portions.
To one half add the gram flour and make a paste with water.
Apply this paste to the slices of jackfruit.
The paste should be such that it sticks to the slices.
Heat ghee in a frying pan and fry the slices till golden brown.
Keep aside. In a pan, chopped onions until lightly browned.
Add the remaining masala paste and all the other ingredients.
Cook well, add jackfruit slices, enough water to cover and cook.
Cook till tender. Sprinkle lemon juice before serving.

recipes.name: Lotus Stem
instructions: Grate the coconut, add 3 cups hot water and extract the milk.
Make a paste from the green chilies, onion, cumin seeds, coriander leaves and tomato.
Wash and clean the lotus stems and cu t into 1⁄2 inch thick slices.
Heat the ghee and fry the red chilies, then add masala paste and cook well.
Add the coconut milk and boil for 15 minutes.
Add sliced lotus stems and salt.
Lower heat and simmer for 1⁄2 hour or until the vegetable is tender.
This vegetable may have a sticky consistency but the flavour is delightful.

recipes.name: Sarson ka Saag
instructions: Wash mustard leaves thoroughly and finely chop them.
In a pot, cook the leaves with salt, garlic, onion, red and green chillies till water from the leaves dries.
Remove from heat and grind when cool. In the same pot, heat oil on medium heat for 3-4 minutes.
Add ground saag (mustard leaves) and stir well for 5-7 minutes.
Add maize flour and mix well. Cover and cook on low heat for 5 minutes and remove from stove.
Garnish and serve hot.

recipes.name: Pomegranate Potatoes
ingredients: 1 kg potatoes (boiled, cut into 1 1/2 inch cubes)
instructions: Heat the butter in a heavy-bottomed pan.
Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and half of the pomegranate seeds.
Mix thoroughly. Add potatoes, salt, and green chillies.
Mix gently, so that the spices coat the potatoes evenly.
Lower heat and simmer for 10 - 15 minutes.
Remove the pan from the heat.
Serve hot garnished with green coriander and the remaining pomegranate seeds.

recipes.name: Tendli and Matki Subzi
instructions: Heat the oil in a pressure cooker and add the cumin seeds.
When seeds crackle, add onions and ginger-green chilli paste & saute till the onions turn translucent.
Add the around gourds, matki, soya granules, turmeric powder, chilli powder, coriander-cumin seed powder, salt and 1/2 cup of water and pressure cook it for 1 to 2 whistles.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
Just before serving, add the tomatoes and mix well.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipes.name: Kadoo Curry
instructions: Put the pumpkin or butternut squash in a saucepan with the turmeric, smoked parpika and the measured water.
Bring to the boil and simmer gently for 6-8 minutes or until tender.
Grind half of the coconut in a spice mill or a mortar and pestle with the cumin seeds.
Stir this into the pumpkin mixture and stir and cook for 2-3 minutes. Remove from the heat.
In a small, nonstick frying pan, heat the oil until hot and add the mustard seeds, curry leaves and red chillies.
Stir and cook over a high heat for 1-2 minutes, then tip this mixture over the pumpkin curry.
Season and serve.

recipes.name: Sweet Corn Kadhi
ingredients: 1/2 cup sweet corn kernels (frozen or tinned)
instructions: Wash green chillies, remove stem and roughly chop.
Peel, wash and grind ginger to a fine paste along with the chopped green chillies.
Peel and slice onion.
Whisk the skimmed milk yogurt with the Bengal tram flour and turmeric, thoroughly.
Stir in two-cups of water and mix.
Pour the yogurt mixture into a thick-bottomed pan and bring it to a boil.
Reduce heat and gradually mix in ginger and green chilli paste, sliced onion and sweet corn, cream style.
Stir well and cook for two to three minutes.
Add the sweet corn kernels and salt to the kadhi and pour one cup water.
Simmer over medium heat for 10 minutes, stirring or till it thickens to a curry consistency.
Heat oil in a small tempering pan, add mustard seeds, fennel seeds, kalonji and dry whole red chillies broken into two.
Stir continuously and cook till they start crackling.
Pour this over sweet corn kadhi & immediately cover with a lid to trap all the flavours & aroma.
Stir well. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Almond Vegetables
instructions: Mix cornflour with half a cup of water. Heat oil in a pan.
Add garlic, ginger and mushrooms and stir-fry for a minute.
Add cauliflower florets, carrot, French beans and a little salt and continue to stir-fry.
Add vegetable stock, white pepper powder and stir.
Blend cornstarch in a little water and keep aside.
Add blanched almonds and half a cup of water to the pan and cook.
Add capsicum, paneer and stir.
Add blended cornstarch and cook for two to three minutes.
Drizzle chilli oil and serve hot.

recipes.name: Carrot Bhurta
instructions: Heat oil, add finely chopped onion till light brown then add all spices stir together.
Now add finely chopped tomatoes, and stir well.
When tomatoes are softened, add mashed carrots, boiled peas and green.
Spice mix it well, cover and cook slowly for another 10 min.
Before remove from heat sprinkle coriander leaves and green chillies.
Serve with crispy, golden puri.

recipes.name: Stuffed Ladyfingers
ingredients: 1/2 kg ladyfingers (chop off both the ends)
1/2 tsp white cumin seeds (roasted and grind each)
5 tbsp tamarind (soak in 1 cup water and take out pulp)
instructions: Mix all spices in tamarind pulp.
Slit ladyfingers and stuff in all the mixture.
Fry till done.

recipes.name: Matar Khoya
instructions: Heat ghee in a pan, add khoya and fry on a low flame.
Keep stirring continuously.
When browned, add all the other ingredients, except for peas, garam masalas, coriander leaves and lemon juice.
Cook for five minutes, add peas and a glass of water.
When peas are tender and the water has dried up, add 1 tsp garam masala. Remove from flame.
Sprinkle lemon juice and serve hot garnished with coriander leaves.
